name: VectorSecurity
0:
”Alexa, tell Vector Security to turn on the lights”
”Alexa, ask Vector Security what the temperature is”
”Alexa, tell Vector Security to lock the door”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: vector security
des:
Don't want to get up from the middle of a movie but you're not sure if you locked the front door? Ask Vector Security to lock the front door. A little hot or too cold, ask Vector Security to set the living room to heat or AC mode. Whatever the scenario, the Vector Security skill adds convenience to monitoring and controlling your system. Here are a few examples of other commands to ask Vector Security: 

Here are a few examples of other commands (start with "Alexa, ask Vector Security..."): 

Security

"...Is my security system (dis)armed?" 
"...Arm stay my security system."

Access
"...Is the garage door open?" 
"...Close the garage door."
"...Is the front door unlocked?"
"...Lock the front door." 

Video Monitoring
"...Record a clip with the living room camera."
"...Pan the living room camera to the couch."

Thermostat
"...What is the temperature?" 
"...Set the living room to AC mode."
"...Set the kitchen thermostat to 72 degrees."

Lights
"...Turn the kitchen light on."
"...Set the living room light to 20 percent."
"...Turn off the lights."

Is the skill having trouble picking up some of your devices? Try changing the name of your equipment to something more common or check your equipment name for spelling errors.

Before using this skill, you will need your Vector Security username and password to link your Vector Security account with Alexa. Please note that the Vector Security skill only works for customers who have integrated systems powered by Alarm.com.

Note: The Vector Security skill does not currently accept thermostat commands while the thermostat is in auto mode.
